name: Hilton Garden Inn Ann Arbor

reviews.text: This new property (one year) in A2 is a "luxury" HGI. Spacious, attractive lobby with infused water. Comfortable rooms. Quiet location despite being on perimeter of a shopping mall. Outside seating area has fire pit (it's chilly middle of October evening here). I have been alternating between Hampton Inn and Sheraton, but this property will be my exclusive choice from now on. Very reasonable rates (at least when the Wolverines are not at home) including a reasonably priced breakfast.
reviews.title: Wow!

reviews.text: I was in Ann Arbor for two nights on business, and the staff made my visit very enjoyable. Very nice workout room, indoor pool. The in house restaurant and bar were pretty solid. The front desk staff were very engaging and friendly.
reviews.title: New property; awesome staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ours was a couples night out close to home. Even though there were several family groups in the hotel, the group activity was controlled and our room was very quiet. Room had excellent accommodations and very comfortable bed. Highly recommend for that much needed "night away" together to focus on each other whether coming from far or near. Location is close to everything!
reviews.title: Couples Night Out

reviews.text: What a wonderful time and experience at the Ann Arbor Hilton Garden Inn. I really don't have time to write reviews, but for the Hilton Inn, i will do so. Great experience overall. The pool, the gym, the people, the room, the bed, checking in, checking out, the breakfast (Don was fantastic and the young ladies that work with him were sincerely, outrageously incredible. Great job to all that works there. I will be back for a U of Michigan football game. Thanks again to the Hilton Garden Inn of Ann Arbor Michigan
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience in Ann Arbor Michigan

reviews.text: The Hilton Garden Inn is a great choice. Hot breakfast, made to order, quality in-room internet and seriously the most comfortable beds of any hotel chain. Highly Recommend. The hotel can be a little hard to find as you have to drive around a mall to get to, but once you do, the staff is friendly and checks you in quickly and you are on your way. I didn't get to use the pool or exercise room but the pool area looked pretty awesome, with a great area for kids. Seems like a very family friendly place, while still catering to those traveling for business.
reviews.title: Most Comfortable Beds in the Market

reviews.text: We really appreciated the great staff and the dining options. Coming in on the plane from out of town, we were very happy to find the restaurant still serving dinner till 10pm; with servers that were still perky even though it was very late for them. We had breakfast as well twice during our stay, and had omelettes cooked to order. The bacon is so-so but the sausage is very good.
reviews.title: Reasonable price and great attitude

reviews.text: Beds were very comfy, the room was clean, and the temperature in the room was adjustable. It is true that if you get an active bunch upstairs, you can hear it pretty clearly. We solved that problem by being exhausted and going to bed despite the noise.
reviews.title: Pretty Good Choice Close To I-94, Briarwood Mall

reviews.text: This hotel is located south of the University of Michigan stadium, so if you are headed north you may run into a LOT of traffic. That's really the only negative.
reviews.title: Good Hotel...Avoid the Breakfast Buffet

reviews.text: There are a lot of good hotel choices in Ann Arbor -- this is definitely one of them!
reviews.title: College Reunion Trip

reviews.text: This is a good-looking property, although the overall experience is not as wonderful as some of the reviews make it out to be (I am always suspicious of reviews by users who have contributed only one review on Trip Advisor).
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Ann Arbor

reviews.text: My family and I spent a night here as we were passing through from NY to the UP. Overall, the place was great! The building seemed very new and was clean, pleasant, and modern. The staff was friendly, and check-in was a breeze. The coolest part though was the pool area. The kids had a couple of hours of fun splashing around in the giant pool, filled with fun play structures, slides, sprinklers, etc. We got a lot of mileage out of that ... much to the parents' delight!
reviews.title: Good, family friendly hotel.

reviews.text: I only had a couple of minor complaints that brought this hotel from a 5 to a 4. (1) The room seemed pretty small. We barely had room for our son's crib. (2) There was some noise from construction, though it wasn't too bad, and I understand that's a temporary issue. (3) The location, next to a mall on the outskirts of town is a bit of a bummer. But, if you're just looking for a convenient stopover, that should be fine.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: Overall, I would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: nice hotel, lousy beds and pillows

reviews.text: I spent the weekend at this hotel and was very impressed with everything it has to offer. It was very clean and the staff was great, they took the time at check in to make sure I had everything I needed and the hole trip was a pleasing one. from the food and drinks at the Bar, to the pool area, it was nice to stay at such a clean and nice place
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.text: overall a nice hotel. decent suburban surroundings. but i couldn't stand the beds and pillows so i slept on the floor. also the rooms had poor ventilation, so they smelled a bit. had a back ache after staying there. fridge and microwave was decent and a coffee maker. nice furishings
reviews.title: Excellent 2-night stay at HGI Ann Arbor; Highly recommend

reviews.text: Hilton Garden Inn Ann Arbor is an excellent choice! The front desk customer service was fabulous! Alivia, Maleek and Adriana delivered fantastic service and made a great impression that began at check-in. This hotel is one of the very nicest I've ever stayed in. It's a gem! The ambience, cleanliness, pool and food are fantastic! The elevators are fast and quiet. The business center is very really nice. It's in a great location and parking is very convenient. The hotel is new which is nice, but what makes it so wonderful is the staff! We will always try to stay here in the future when visiting Ann Arbor.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel!

reviews.text: This hotel was far better than advertised. I'm still trying to figure out if there was one negative to write about. BTW...all hotels need to hire staff like the Garden Inn in Ann Arbor. Best hotel experience ever! Can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: First but not last visit to A2

reviews.text: This is my second stay at this particular property, and I must say, each and everyone at the front desk staff was very professional and helpful, the only one thing I wish to bring to your attention is, couple of times while in an elevator, we saw one housekeeping staff, and another time I guess it was maintenance staff. They did not greet any of us, we were three more people from different rooms, Not that it matters, But my self coming from an hospitality back ground, These small little gestures do matter to other guests. My over all experience was very good. I appreciate the breakfast attendant's help and Chef's willing ness to prepare breakfast past breakfast hours, Our Thanks to Malik and girls working with him( the girls under training) and night Auditor Anthony. Thank you all for making my stay Comfortable.
reviews.title: repeat guest

reviews.text: We went to visit the University, and decided to stay here based on other reviews. They were definitely accurate. The room was very comfortable, and everything was clean. Location is not great for visiting UM, as parking in the city of Ann Arbor can be difficult, but that isn't any fault of this hotel. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Though not luxurious, this is a very comfortable hotel, and I would definitely stay here again if in town.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Ann Arbor

reviews.text: Stayed here for business for three nights. Yes the hotel is new has a nicely lite parking lot, but it still is like an upgraded holiday inn. I will note that the indoor pool is nice and pretty large, although I did not have a chance to enjoy it but it looked nice. I ordered room service once and when calling I asked for the fish and chips and the person who answered the phone said they had just sold their last fish and chips, but I thought they were made to order. Anyhow I then opted to an order of appetizer wings and a slice of cheesecake. I was disappointed in the wings as they were heavily breaded or had lots of skin and little meat. The room was nice (typical), a little dark and I guess it was nice nice enough, but again this is a typical hotel chain, nothing too extra. I stayed previously at the Sheraton here in Ann Arbor and I guess you just get a little more luxury there. I will stay at the Sheraton again for my upcoming stay again, as that is more my speed. I did also have the breakfast buffet and that was pretty good and I must note that the staff was pretty friendly and everything was clean.
reviews.title: A chain hotel

description: The Hilton Garden Inn Ann Arbor hotel is ideally located just 2 miles south of the University of Michigan and its “Big House” football stadium, as well as the adjacent Briarwood Mall. Enjoy easy access to the UM campus plus nearby research parks, hospitals and medical centers. Unwind in a spacious guest room and enjoy the latest technology to ensure you make the most of your stay. Keep in touch with complimentary wireless internet access and sleep well in the sumptuous bed. Indulge in a delicious meal at the hotel's onsite restaurant, The Great American Grill, open daily for breakfast and dinner. For the convenience of dining within your room, grab a quick snack or tasty microwavable meal from the hotel's great value, 24-hour Pavilion Pantry or order a meal from room service. The cozy Pavilion Lounge offers the perfect spot to unwind after a busy day. Stay active with an energetic workout in the 24-hour fitness center or enjoy a splash in the "Cool Pool" complete with basketball hoop and volleyball. The Hilton Garden Inn Ann Arbor also offers four flexible meeting rooms, ideal for meetings, seminars and presentations.
